tool_description: The first social network for developers and the tech community.
name: Geeklist
title: Geeklist

api_list.name: Get Specified Users Cards

optional_parameters.name: featured
optional_parameters.description: Returns only featured cards for user (only for cards and not contribs).

api_list.name: Get Authenticated Users Activity
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://geeklist.p.rapidapi.com/user/activity"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "geeklist.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Individual Micro
Highfive Item

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: The type of item being highfived.

required_parameters.name: gfk
required_parameters.description: The id of the item being highfived.

api_list.name: Get Popular Links

optional_parameters.name: communities
optional_parameters.description: The community you want to see the popular links from.

api_list.name: All Activity

optional_parameters.name: feed
optional_parameters.description: Specifies which feed to pull data from. By default it uses the authenticated users personal feed. Options include: discovery, at, community

optional_parameters.name: filter
optional_parameters.description: Allows filtering of personal and discovery feeds by activity types. Options include: micro, card, link, highfive, follow, vote, commit

optional_parameters.name: hash
optional_parameters.description: Hash will give you only micros that contain the hash (#gklst) from the discovery feed.

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description: Since the activity feeds are sorted descending by date, you can specify a starting activity id and fetch any activities older than that id with the limit you set.

api_list.name: Get Specified Users Following
